page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable daylight plane protrusions summary

Feature                      Allowable protrusion                                                                 Illustration

Television and radio antennas  up to 15' above maximum building height

Chimneys and flues < 5' wide  may extend beyond the daylight plane to meet minimum required clearance of Building Code (Chapter 16.04)  Fig 20 on p. 26

Dormers, roof decks, gables, or similar architectural features  each feature ≤ 7.5' long and cumulative length of all features ≤ 15' with min 5' separation between features (on each side); height ≤ 24';  Fig 20 on p. 26 & Fig 23 on p. 28

Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features (excluding flat or continuous walls or enclosures usable for interior space)  max 2'  Fig 22 on p. 27

29

visual_elements.description: A summary table listing features, their allowable protrusions beyond the daylight plane, and references to illustrations. The table has three columns: Feature, Allowable protrusion, and Illustration. Features include Television and radio antennas, Chimneys and flues < 5' wide, Dormers/roof decks/gables or similar architectural features, and Cornices/eaves and similar architectural features. Allowable protrusions specify height or length limits and conditions. Illustrations are referenced by figure numbers and page numbers.

technical_specifications.parameter: Television and radio antennas allowable protrusion

technical_specifications.value: may extend beyond the daylight plane to meet minimum required clearance of Building Code (Chapter 16.04)

technical_specifications.parameter: Dormers, roof decks, gables or similar architectural features - each feature length
Dormers, roof decks, gables or similar architectural features - cumulative length of all features
Dormers, roof decks, gables or similar architectural features - minimum separation between features
Dormers, roof decks, gables or similar architectural features - height
Cornices, eaves, and similar architectural features maximum protrusion

additional_notes: Page number 29 at bottom right corner
No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings detected
Layout consists of a single centered table under a bold heading with three columns separated by horizontal lines
